question.questionB: Plant not twining; leaves not cordate.

question.questionA: Plants monoecious, male flowers in the upper part of the stem, female flowers below; the outer three perianth segments becoming spiny in fruit.
question.questionB: Flowers  hermaphrodite  or  plants  dioecious;  perianth  segments  not becoming spiny in fruit.

question.questionA: Perianth of  five equal segments, petal-like, pink or white, persistent in fruit.
question.questionB: Perianth of six segments, the inner whorl of three larger than the outer and becoming  further  enlarged  in  fruit, often dentate and bearing a tubercle on the outside.

question.questionA: Flowers  in racemes towards the top of the stem; racemes  exceeding  theleaves; leaves lanceolate.
question.questionB: Flowers in axillary clusters, much shorter than the leaves; leaves ovate.

question.questionA: Woody perennials; internodes short; leaves overlapping.
question.questionB: Herbaceous annuals or short-lived perennials; internodes long; leaves not overlapping.

question.questionA: Annuals; leaves less than 2 cm, lanceolate; flowers in terminal  racemes; perianth segments with marginal teeth but no tubercles.
question.questionB: Perennials;  leaves more than 5 cm; inflorescences axillary; perianth segments with tubercles.

question.questionA: Flowers in short panicles; pedicels jointed at the middle, decurrent; outer perianth segments dentate with thick veins.
question.questionB: Flowers  in  long  racemes; pedicels not jointed at the middle; outer perianth segments winged.

question.questionA: Leaves sagittate; inflorescence branched with filiform bracts; tubercles usually green.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate or  lanceolate;  inflorescence unbranched with  leaf-like bracts; tubercles usually red.

question.questionA: Margins of leaves undulate; pedicels more than twice the length of the perianth, jointed below the middle; tubercles narrow.
question.questionB: Margins of leaves not  undulate;  pedicels less than twice the length of the perianth; tubercles broad.

question.questionA: Outer perianth segments ovate, entire, each bearing a large tubercle.
question.questionB: Outer  perianth  segments  triangular,  dentate,  only  one  of  the  three bearing a large tubercle.
